alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Eastern Black Range Foothills; Southern Gila Foothills, Mimbres Valley; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 2:20PM MST until January 01 at 5:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches possible by Saturday afternoon between 6,000 and 7,500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, creating areas of reduced visibilities in blowing and drifting snow on Saturday. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest New Mexico. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Eastern Black Range Foothills; Southern Gila Foothills, Mimbres Valley; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
